responsibilities: Contribute to the OpenLineage and Airflow Open Source community to enhance data collection and extraction of OpenLineage events from Airflow.
Contribute to the design, development, and vision of Astro Observe’s ingestion pipelines.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand user requirements and implement observability and governance features.
Contribute to the overall platform usability, reliability, and scalability.
qualifications: Strong focus on helping customers gain more visibility and actionable insights through observability offerings.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to find middle ground.
Experience with software development best practices, such as code reviews, testing, CI/CD, version control, automation, and debugging.
analysis: The job responsibilities focus on contributing to open-source communities, enhancing data collection, designing ingestion pipelines, and collaborating with teams for observability and governance features. The skills required include experience with Python, communication skills, and software development best practices. There is no mention of working with Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs) in the responsibilities or skills. The focus is more on data collection, observability, and software development rather than AI or language models.
